title: Mark Wilson's all-action cameo spoke volumes for both his character and the strength of England's 'finishers'
text:
Entering the final ten minutes down 19-7, New Zealand were down but not quite out. In boxing terms, they were trailing on all the scorecards, yet still capable of that 12th round knockout.

Time and time again, the All Blacks have engineered victories from situations more improbable than this. Against South Africa last year, they trailed 23-6 on 52 minutes and 30-18 with four minutes remaining. All they need is that one opportunity to throw that famed right hook.

It came on 70 minutes. For once they were able to spread the ball at pace from left to right to Sevu Reece. With Billy Vunipola struggling to cover ground, the wing burst between him and Elliot Daly. In an instant the ball had been transferred...
description: Entering the final ten minutes down 19-7, New Zealand were down but not quite out.
